page.title: 02Farming _ Leck area
page.content: In the 18th century land was enclosed by walls and hedges and formed the farms we now know.Because of the contours of the land and the high rain fall farming patterns have changed very little.There has always been mixed farming i.e.dairy cows, beef, rearing young stock and sheep. Changes due to mechanisation have made the most impact on farming. Once upon a time work was done by horses and many more men were employed on farms. Now we have a lot more farm implements and not as many farm workers. Farms in our area are mainly family farms run by fathers and sons. Before, farms made mainly hay but now they make more silage. Dairy cows are now loose-housed but they used to be tied up and they are now milked in a milking parlour, not by hand.
